title: (x) "Made in California" rounded sans - custom (similar to Magda Clean) {Yves (Stephen)}
content:
Does anyone recognize this? I’ve been looking for a font that has the presence of Foundry’s Gridnik without the hard angles. I’m a magazine art director and my editors absolutely hate Gridnik and fonts like it. I’m curious about this one and am open to any other suggestions. Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Rounded%20sans.jpg)

 [‹ (x) License plate fonts - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19362 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Wynn Las Vegas logo humanist sans - Gill Sans {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19462 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kwebb

comments.content: It could be [FF Magda Clean](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11051.1.7&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=CAL+ART+IMAGE&sampleSize=48) with some customization and stencilization. You also might like [FF Oxide](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Oxide) and [Stratum](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234358/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Stratum).

That just might be it. The A is different, but otherwise appears to be it. Thanks for the other suggestions. I love Oxide. If only it had a lower case. Stratum is a solid suggestion as well.

Much appreciated Stephen.

— K
